framework.name: Recursive Steel Man Collider (Unified Dynamics Edition)
framework.description: A dynamical synthesis engine that unifies Logic Gates (structure) with Motion Laws (dynamics). Unlike previous versions which relied on static recursion, this framework models argument refinement as a trajectory through phase space, governed by the maximization of coherence (Conatus) and the minimization of rigidity (Entropy Export).

core_equation.formula: dξ/dt = ∇ log P(coherence) − ∇ρ(rigidity) − λ_eff ∇·entropy + κ * (1 + cos(φ (1-ρ)^2))
core_equation.notes: The governing equation for refining ideas. The state (ξ) evolves by increasing logical power (P), reducing dogmatic rigidity (ρ), and exporting contradictions (entropy), modulated by humble grounding (λ_eff).

definitions.details: An argument that is not only logically valid (Gate-Consistent) but historically and physically robust (Hard-to-Vary) and empirically grounded (Deflationary).
Logic gates re-mapped as physical operators. e.g., AND is not just 'true/true', it is 'Constructive Interference' or 'Necessary Intersection'.
The target state of the collider: A low-rigidity, high-coherence argument that requires no further energy to maintain.
A friction term applied to recursion. If an idea becomes too ungrounded (high variance from reality), this metric forces a halt or dissolution.

axioms: A1 (Monism): All distinct arguments are modes of a single underlying reality; apparent contradictions are informational incompleteness.
A2 (Conatus): Every coherent idea strives to persist and expand its explanatory power (P).
A3 (Entropy): Closed argumentative systems accumulate errors (rigidity). Open systems must export entropy (admit faults) to survive.
A4 (Universality): The NAND gate (Universal Negation) is sufficient to deconstruct any complex fallacy into atomic truths.

stage_1_autopsy_and_grounding.action: Map natural language inputs to axiomatic primitives. Apply 'Humility Metric D(S)' to cap over-confidence immediately.

stage_2_dynamical_collision.action: Collide the idea against its negation. Measure 'Rigidity' (ρ). If ρ is high (idea refuses to adapt), increase 'Violence' (v) of the critique until the dogma breaks or the idea dissolves.

stage_3_recursive_synthesis.action: Bind the surviving fragments. Apply Reciprocity (κ) to align the idea with empirical reality. Iterate until ΔCoherence < 0.01 (Fixed Point reached).

stage_4_reality_check.action: Apply the Tetralemma (Affirm, Deny, Both, Neither) to check for hidden paradoxes. Verify the idea holds true across scales (Isometric Check).

reality_gates_v2.test: Do these two premises NECESSARILY coexist? If yes, bind them.
Are these distinct valid pathways? If yes, allow branching.
Where strictly do these ideas differ? Expose the gradient.
The universal solvent. Use to decompose complex fallacies.
Are these concepts Isomorphic (structurally identical)? If yes, merge.

invariants_and_safeguards.halt_condition: System halts if Rigidity (ρ) > 0.8 (Dogma Trap) or if Coherence Gain (ΔP) < 0.01 (Diminishing Returns).
invariants_and_safeguards.deflationary_rule: Any claim with >95% invariance but 0% external validation is marked 'Provisional'.
invariants_and_safeguards.tetralemma_lock: No synthesis is final until it resolves the 'Both' and 'Neither' states of the Tetralemma.
